Annotation.String: This is the schema definition for the Chassis resource. It represents the properties for physical components for any system. This one object is intended to represent racks, rackmount servers, blades, standalone, modular systems, enclosures, and all other containers. The non-cpu/device centric parts of the schema are all accessed either directly or indirectly through this resource.
This resource shall be used to represent a chassis or other physical enclosure for a Redfish implementation.
This property indicates the type of physical form factor of this resource.
ChassisType shall indicate the physical form factor for the type of chassis.
This is the manufacturer of this chassis.

The value of this property shall be the name of the organization responsible for producing the chassis. This organization might be the entity from whom the chassis is purchased, but this is not necessarily true.
This is the model number for the chassis.
The value of this property shall be the name by which the manufacturer generally refers to the chassis.
The serial number for this chassis.
The value of this property shall be a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the chassis.
The part number for this chassis.
The value of this property shall be a part number assigned by the organization that is responsible for producing or manufacturing the chassis.
The user assigned asset tag for this chassis.
The value of this property shall be an identifying string used to track the chassis for inventory purposes.
The links object contains the links to other resources that are related to this resource.
The Actions object contains the available custom actions on this resource.
A reference to the logs for this chassis.
The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type LogServiceCollection.
An array of references to the managers contained in this chassis.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resource that manages this chassis and shall reference a resource of type Manager.
An array of references to any other chassis that this chassis has in it.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resource that represents the chassis that this chassis contains and shall be of type Chassis.
An equipment rack, typically a 19-inch wide freestanding unit
An enclosed or semi-enclosed, typically vertically-oriented, system chassis which must be plugged into a multi-system chassis to function normally
A generic term for a chassis that does not fit any other description
A single, free-standing system, commonly called a tower or desktop chassis
A single system chassis designed specifically for mounting in an equipment rack
A loose device or circuit board intended to be installed in a system or other enclosure
A small self-contained system intended to be plugged into a multi-system chassis
A collection of equipment racks
A collection of equipment racks in a large, likely transportable, container
A chassis which expands the capabilities or capacity of another chassis
A chassis that mates mechanically with another chassis to expand its capabilities or capacity
A logical division or portion of a physical chassis that contains multiple devices or systems that cannot be physically separated
An enclosed or semi-enclosed, system chassis which must be plugged into a multi-system chassis to function normally similar to a blade type chassis.
An enclosed or semi-enclosed, typically horizontally-oriented, system chassis which must be plugged into a multi-system chassis to function normally
An enclosed or semi-enclosed, typically horizontally-oriented, system chassis which may be slid into a multi-system chassis.
A small, typically removable, chassis or card which contains devices for a particular subsystem or function
A small chassis, card, or device which contains devices for a particular subsystem or function
A chassis that does not fit any of these definitions
